item.title: 格鲁吉亚总理在欧盟与抗议者发生冲突后排除了与反对派会谈的可能性
item.description: 格鲁吉亚总理排除了与反对派举行会谈的可能性。此前，格鲁吉亚首都连续四晚发生暴力冲突，致使拉里对美元的汇率跌至两年来的最低点。【原文：Georgia’s premier ruled out holding talks with the opposition after four nights of violent clashes in the capital helped propel the lari to a two-year low against the dollar.】

item.title: 声名狼藉的瑞士信贷债券助长了 Ken Leech 的欺诈指控
item.description: 去年，瑞士最高监管机构的一个惊人举动引发了整个债券市场的愤怒。至少对一位资深人士来说，这一举动变成了更糟糕的事情。【原文：A shock move by a top Swiss regulator last year sparked outrage across the bond market. For at least one veteran, it turned into something much worse.】

item.title: 稳定性风险缓解，奥地利将放宽抵押贷款限额
item.description: 奥地利金融市场稳定委员会将于明年取消对住房贷款的严格限制，认为房地产市场过热的危险已经过去。【原文：Austria’s Financial Market Stability Board will let strict limits on home loans expire next year, arguing that the danger of overheating in the property market has now passed.】

item.title: 萨利纳斯一天内将损失 40 亿美元，Elektra 暴跌 60
item.description: 在监管机构下令交易所恢复长期停牌后，Grupo Elektra 股价周一暴跌超过 60%，亿万富翁里卡多-萨利纳斯-普利戈（Ricardo Salinas Pliego）的身家因此缩水约 40 亿美元。【原文：Shares of Grupo Elektra tumbled more than 60% on Monday after regulators ordered the exchange to resume trading following a prolonged halt, wiping off some $4 billion from the fortune of billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego.】

item.title: 前万事达首席运营官为俄罗斯经营 "高级 "保加利亚间谍组织
item.description: 检察官在伦敦对三名被控为俄罗斯从事间谍活动的保加利亚人进行审判时说，在逃的前万通卡首席运营官扬-马萨莱克（Jan Marsalek）在一次国际间谍活动中发挥了关键作用。【原文：Jan Marsalek, the fugitive ex-Wirecard chief operating office, played a crucial role in an international espionage operation, prosecutors said at the London trial of three Bulgarians accused of spying for Russia.】

item.title: 高盛顶级战略家展望 2025 年
item.description:
对于市场和经济而言，这是充满不确定性的一年。【原文：

An uncertain year for markets and the economy.

】

item.title: 前往纽约市的新泽西运输公司和美铁列车服务暂停或延误
item.description: 周一早上，由于三州部分地区气温冰冻，进出纽约宾夕法尼亚车站的新泽西运输公司（New Jersey Transit）和美国铁路公司（Amtrak）列车出现长时间延误。【原文：New Jersey Transit and Amtrak trains coming into and out of New York Penn Station are experiencing lengthy delays Monday morning as freezing temperatures hit parts of the tristate area.】

item.title: 希腊告诉投资者不打算对银行征收额外税款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，希腊并不打算对银行征收任何特别税。【原文：Greece isn’t planning to impose any extraordinary tax on its banks, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 订单增加，美国工厂活动萎缩幅度低于预期
item.description: 美国 11 月份制造业活动的萎缩幅度低于预期，因为一项衡量新订单的指标八个月来首次进入扩张区间，并表明企业信心正在逐步改善。【原文：US manufacturing activity shrank in November by less than forecast as a gauge of new orders moved into expansion territory for the first time in eight months and indicated business confidence is gradually improving.】

item.title: 英国希望在实现 2.5% 目标之前加强军工供应链
item.description: 在政府准备就何时增加国防开支做出更明确承诺的同时，英国将 "比试 "其国内供应链和军队如何抵御未来的冲击。【原文：The UK will “war game” how well its domestic supply chain and military can withstand future shocks, as the government prepares a clearer commitment on when it will increase defense spending.】

item.title: 降临公司着眼于新的中型市场战略，进行小型交易
item.description: 收购公司安宏资本（Advent）正在考虑设立一个以中型交易为目标的投资工具，以加强其核心私募股权业务。【原文：Buyout firm Advent is contemplating setting up an investment vehicle targeting mid-sized transactions as it looks to bolster its core private equity business.】

item.title: 市场为大数据周和美联储发言人做准备，国债下跌
item.description: 美国国债周一下跌，因为交易员们正在等待本周大量的经济数据和美联储高官的讲话，这些数据和讲话可能将决定人们对央行本月下一次政策决定的预期。【原文：US Treasuries fell on Monday as traders awaited a hefty week of economic data and speeches from high-profile Federal Reserve officials that will likely determine expectations for the central bank’s next policy decision this month.】

item.title: 波罗的海航空公司制定了安全后飞回乌克兰的计划
item.description: 波罗的海航空公司（AirBaltic）表示，在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰切断该国空中联系三年之后，该公司已经制定了一项计划，将在接到空域重新开放通知的短时间内恢复飞往乌克兰的航班。【原文：AirBaltic said it’s developed a plan to resume flights to Ukraine at short notice of the airspace reopening, three years after the Russian invasion severed the country’s air links.】

item.title: 超微将任命新首席财务官，称无证据显示存在不当行为
item.description: 超级微电脑公司（Super Micro Computer Inc.【原文：Super Micro Computer Inc. said an external review of its business by a special committee of its board and external counsel found no evidence of wrongdoing and that the company will appoint new top financial leadership.】

item.title: 法国政府将不经投票通过社会保障法案LCI电视台
item.description: LCI电视台称，法国总理米歇尔-巴尼耶（Michel Barnier）将利用宪法工具，不经议会投票通过其不受欢迎的预算法案的部分内容。【原文：French Prime Minister Michel Barnier will use a constitutional tool to push through parts of his unpopular budget bill without a parliamentary vote, LCI television said.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官盖尔辛格离职，芯片制造商扭亏为盈举步维艰
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp.英特尔公司首席执行官帕特-盖尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）于 2021 年受聘领导这家标志性芯片制造商雄心勃勃的扭亏为盈计划，但在扭亏为盈计划遭遇挫折、公司进一步落后于竞争对手之后，他将离职。【原文：Intel Corp. Chief Executive Officer Pat Gelsinger, who was hired in 2021 to lead an ambitious turnaround of the iconic chipmaker, will leave the job after the comeback sputtered and the company only fell further behind rivals.】

item.title: 微策略公司连续第四周购买比特币
item.description: 微策略公司又购买了 15 亿美元的比特币，这是这家加密对冲基金代理公司连续第四个星期宣布购买比特币。【原文：MicroStrategy Inc. bought another $1.5 billion in Bitcoin, the fourth consecutive weekly purchase announced by the crypto hedge fund proxy.】

item.title: 英国制裁后巴拿马禁止六艘船只悬挂其国旗
item.description: 巴拿马正在取消上周被英国制裁的六艘悬挂其国旗的船只的注册，这对制裁莫斯科石油出口的西方国家来说是一个鼓舞。【原文：Panama is canceling the registration of six ships sailing under its flag that were sanctioned by the UK last week, a boost for Western nations that have slapped sanctions on Moscow’s oil exports.】

item.title: 城堡水务公司将出价 40 亿英镑入股拯救泰晤士水务公司
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，城堡水务有限公司（Castle Water Ltd.）将于本周向泰晤士水务公司注资 40 亿英镑（约合 51 亿美元），以帮助这家陷入困境的公用事业公司摆脱困境。【原文：Castle Water Ltd. will offer to inject £4 billion ($5.1 billion) into Thames Water this week to help save the beleaguered utility from administration, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 商品交易文化在瑞士接受审判
item.description:
Trafigura公司及其前首席运营官被指控行贿。【原文：

Trafigura and its former chief operating officer stand accused of bribery.

】

item.title: 欧洲将迎来寒冷天气，交易商退出柴油空头押注
item.description: 资金经理们正在削减对欧洲柴油基准的押注。【原文：Money managers are slashing wagers against Europe’s diesel benchmark.】

item.title: 欧盟新领导层将于下月概述竞争力计划
item.description: 欧盟执行机构计划于下月提交一份计划大纲，说明在推行雄心勃勃的清洁技术改革的同时，如何提高欧盟与美国和中国的竞争力。【原文：The European Union’s executive arm plans to present next month the outlines of a plan for how to boost the bloc’s competitiveness with the US and China as it pursues an ambitious clean-tech overhaul.】

item.title: 警察与抗议者发生冲突后，格鲁吉亚拉里创两年新低
item.description: 在执政党决定推迟有关加入欧盟的谈判并在首都引发暴力冲突之后，格鲁吉亚拉里兑美元汇率跌至两年来最弱水平。【原文：Georgia’s lari fell to the weakest level against the dollar in two years after a decision by the ruling party to delay talks on European Union membership triggered violent clashes in the capital city.】

item.title: 巴西分析师上调利率预测，因削减支出效果不佳
item.description: 在政府上周宣布的削减开支计划未能缓解市场对财政政策的焦虑之后，巴西经济学家上调了明年的利率和通胀预期。【原文：Brazil economists increased their interest rate and inflation estimates for next year after the government’s spending cut plan announced last week failed to ease market anxiety over fiscal policy.】

item.title: 上周美国经济数据大跌和黑色星期五的启示
item.description: 我是塞西尔-道拉特（Cécile Daurat），美国经济编辑。今天我们将关注上周美国的一系列数据。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您尚未注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击此处。【原文：I’m Cécile Daurat, an economics editor in the US. item.title: 如何解读特朗普的最新关税威胁大棒
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普距离再次入主白宫还有七个星期的时间，但他已经威胁要对拥有全球 80 亿人口中近一半的国家征收新的关税。这意味着我们正在重新学习如何消化这位当选总统的威胁。【原文：Donald Trump is seven weeks away from re-entering the White House and yet he’s already threatened to slap new tariffs on countries that are home to almost half the world’s 8 billion people. Which means we are learning all over again how to digest the president-elect’s threats.】

item.title: 英伟达斥资 7 亿美元参与 Nebius 人工智能云服务交易
item.description: 由俄罗斯互联网巨头 Yandex 改名而来的技术公司 Nebius Group NV 已从包括 Nvidia Corp. 和 Accel Partners LP 在内的众多投资者处筹集了 7 亿美元。【原文：Nebius Group NV, the technology company rebranded from Russian internet giant Yandex, has raised $700 million from a slate of investors including Nvidia Corp. and Accel Partners LP.】

item.title: 受特朗普关税威胁影响，菲律宾调整 2025 年经济增长展望
item.description: 菲律宾扩大了明年的预计增长范围，理由是美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策可能意味着 "到处都是高关税"，存在不确定性。【原文：The Philippines widened its projected growth range for next year, citing uncertainties over US President-elect Donald Trump’s trade policy that could mean “high tariffs everywhere.”】

item.title: 骗子盗取 70 万欧元后，Revolut 面临英国欺诈诉讼
item.description: Revolut 有限公司正面临英国的一项诉讼，作为欺诈索赔的一部分，该公司可能要向一家塞尔维亚能源公司支付 70 万欧元（约合 735,880 美元），这让人质疑骗子在金融科技平台上操作的便利性。【原文：Revolut Ltd. is facing a UK lawsuit that could see it pay a Serbian energy company €700,000 ($735,880) as part of a fraud claim, calling into question the ease that scammers can operate on the fintech platform.】

item.title: 人民币表示，尼日利亚最新欧元债券销售将迎来强劲需求
item.description: 尼日利亚两年多来首次出售欧元债券，因为这个非洲国家正在努力减少财政赤字。【原文：Nigeria is selling eurobonds for the first time in more than two years as the African nation seeks reduce its fiscal deficit.】
